intro: Androsace aflatunensis, commonly known as the Armenian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to survive in arid and cold environments. Androsace aflatunensis is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
